resources.string: Exercise not saved because it is empty!

Lower yourself down by bending your arms at the elbow joints, continuing to hold the shoulder blades in this position and maintaining the anatomically correct curves of the spine. Your elbows are at about a 45 degree angle from your torso. Then smoothly return to the starting position.
Lying on your back on the gymnastics mat raise your torso. Hands behind head "in lock", shoulder blades touching the mat, legs bent at right angles, feet pressed to the floor.

Straighten your arms above your head. Exhale, tense your abs and hold your breath. Pull your head, shoulders and shoulder blades off the floor, keeping your lower back pressed against it. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat.
Stand up straight, with your feet shoulder width apart, and do short bends first to one side and then to the other, trying not to bend your knees.

Lie on your back, relax. Legs straight, lying on the floor. Place your hands under your lower back, palms down, to support your lower back. As you exhale, lift straight legs up, contracting the abdominal muscles. Once your abs have contracted as much as possible, slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.

Grasp a pair of dumbbells on the floor, palms facing each other. Place the dumbbells so that they are in line with or slightly wider than your shoulders. Stand in a high plank position, keeping the cortex muscles tense. Bend your arms at the elbows and lower your torso to the floor. Rest your palms on dumbbells. Do push-ups and return to standing position.

Grab the dumbbells and hold your hands with your palms facing your body. Bend your elbows and bring the dumbbells to your shoulders while turning your wrists outward. At the top point, palms should be turned toward the body.
Put your feet on the ball, lower yourself down, keeping the anatomically correct curves of the spine, then gently return to the starting position.

Keep your back straight and your pelvis in a central position. Put your left foot on your toes, bending at the knee. Bend your left leg to the left, but do not twist your body to follow it. Lift the foot of the bent leg.
